meanings.definition: The subjects comprising a course of study in a school or college.
meanings.sent1: In our school, the curriculums include math, science, and history.
meanings.sent2: Students can choose from a variety of curriculums to tailor their education.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to explore the curriculums of the library books.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden, with curriculums blooming like colorful flowers.
meanings.sent5: The curriculums were like puzzle pieces, fitting together to form a complete picture of learning.

meanings.definition: The total sum of courses offered by an educational institution.
meanings.sent1: The university's curriculums cover a wide range of subjects for students to choose from.
meanings.sent2: Exploring different curriculums can help students discover their interests.
meanings.sent3: The curriculums on the school website seemed to be never-ending.
meanings.sent4: His knowledge expanded like the branches of a tree, each representing a different curriculum.
meanings.sent5: She dove into the curriculums like a swimmer entering the pool, eager to learn and grow.

meanings.definition: The planned sequence of courses and experiences offered by an educational institution.
meanings.sent1: Following the curriculum ensures that students learn key concepts in a logical order.
meanings.sent2: Teachers work together to create a cohesive curriculum for the school year.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to sneak a peek at the upcoming curriculums.
meanings.sent4: The curriculum was a roadmap, guiding students through their educational journey.
meanings.sent5: Each curriculum was a chapter in the book of education, building upon the last for a complete story of learning.
